lead_paragraph: Adam Scott made a birdie from 6 feet on the third playoff hole to beat Ernie Els and defend his title at the rain-shortened Singapore Open. Organizers ended the $3 million tournament at 54 holes after the fourth round was abandoned with Els and Scott sharing a three-stroke buffer on the leader board at 10 under after eight holes. The playoff was based on third-round scores, which Scott and Els led by three strokes at eight-under 205.
